item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content.

item.title: Migrate to Hugo from Jekyll
item.description: Move static content to static Jekyll has a rule that any directory not starting with _ will be copied as-is to the _site output. Hugo keeps all static content under static.

item.title: About Hugo
item.description: Hugo is the worldâ€™s fastest framework for building websites. It is written in Go. It makes use of a variety of open source projects including:

item.title: (Hu)go Template Primer
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent Go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Step 1. Install Hugo Go to Hugo releases and download the appropriate version for your OS and architecture. Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step.
